page.title: 17SUPERNATURAL
page.content: Some areas of the Mendips are desolate and ghosts and legends of the supernatural are common. In 1835 it was reported in a local paper that the cottagers at Eaker Hill saw an "immense body of troops" fully armed and in uniform.The cottagers were deeply worried, imagining the troops were a hostile force. There are stories of the west door of the church in Chewton Mendip glowing a bright green and gusts of wind blowing through the church when there was no sign of wind outside. The recent occupants of The Old Rectory have seen and heard a ghost on four separate occasions and claim it is a man that haunts their house. In Litton a ghost is said to roam on Shortwood Common.The ghost is supposed to be a postman who was murdered.
